Method Detail

readMonopolyFile

public void readMonopolyFile(String filename,
                             MonopVars vars,
                             Token tokens,
                             ArrayList<Property> properties)
                      throws IOException,
                             BadDataException
A Monopoly data file should be separated into three sections:

1: Monopoly variable data
2: Monopoly token data
3: Monopoly property data

Parameters:
filename - the name of the file holding the data
vars - the MonopVars object for the game
tokens - the Token object for the game
properties - the ArrayList to which properties should be added
Throws:
IOException
BadDataException

readVarsData

public void readVarsData(Scanner in,
                         MonopVars vars)
                  throws BadDataException
Reads the set of data for the MonopVars object

Format for a MonopVars data should appear as follows:
*game name* - String
*currency symbol* - String
(All the following ints appear on the same line)
*go amount* *starting money amount* *jail bail fee* *number of dice sides* - all ints
*monopoly color #1* - String
*monopoly color #2* - String
...
*monopoly color #8* - String

Parameters:
in - the scanner that scans the data
vars - the MonopVars object
Throws:
BadDataException

readTokenData

public void readTokenData(Scanner in,
                          Token tokens)
                   throws BadDataException
Reads the set of data for the Tokens object.

Token information should be in the following format:
*number of tokens (min. 2)* - int
*token #1* - String
*token #2* - String
...
*token #n* - String

Parameters:
in - the scanner that scans the data
tokens - the Token object.
Throws:
BadDataException

readPropertyData

public void readPropertyData(Scanner in,
                             ArrayList<Property> properties)
                      throws BadDataException
Reads the set of Property data for the properties ArrayList.

See the getType() method of the Property class

Parameters:
in - the scanner that scans the data
properties - the ArrayList of Property objects.
Throws:
BadDataException

readMonopolyProperty

public Property readMonopolyProperty(Scanner in,
                                     int type,
                                     int index)
                              throws BadDataException
Reads the set of Property data for a Property of type MonopolyProperty.

Monopoly properties should appear in this format:
*property type* - int (see Property class)
*property name* - String
(all on same line in this order separated by spaces) *cost* *mortgage* *index of Monopoly color* *basic rent* *rent w/1 house* *rent w/2houses* *rent w/3houses* *rent w/4houses* *rent w/hotel* *building cost* - all ints

Parameters:
in - the scanner that scans the data
type - the type of Property this is.
index - the index of this Property on the board.
Throws:
BadDataException

readRailroadProperty

public Property readRailroadProperty(Scanner in,
                                     int type,
                                     int index)
                              throws BadDataException
Reads the set of Property data for a Property of type RailroadProperty.

Railroads & Utilities should appear in this format:
*property type* - int (see Property class)
*name of railroad/utility* - String
(both variables below are on the same line)
*cost* *mortgage* - both ints

Parameters:
in - the scanner that scans the data
type - the type of Property this is.
index - the index of this Property on the board.
Throws:
BadDataException

readUtilityProperty

public Property readUtilityProperty(Scanner in,
                                    int type,
                                    int index)
                             throws BadDataException
Reads the set of Property data for a Property of type UtilityProperty.

Railroads & Utilities should appear in this format:
*property type* - int (see Property class)
*name of railroad/utility* - String
(both variables below are on the same line)
*cost* *mortgage* - both ints

Parameters:
in - the scanner that scans the data
type - the type of Property this is.
index - the index of this Property on the board.
Throws:
BadDataException

readProperty

public Property readProperty(Scanner in,
                             int type,
                             int index)
                      throws BadDataException
Reads the set of Property data for a regular Property.

All other properties should appear in this format:
*property type* - int (see Property class)
*property name* - String

Parameters:
in - the scanner that scans the data
type - the type of Property this is.
index - the index of this Property on the board.
Throws:
BadDataException
